FuncDef:
The igmp snooping group-policy command limits the range of multicast groups that hosts can join.
The undo igmp snooping group-policy command cancels the configuration. The igmp snooping group-policy command limits the range of multicast groups that hosts can join. The undo igmp snooping group-policy command cancels the configuration. By default, hosts can join any multicast group. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: 100GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,200GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,400GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,50GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk Layer 2 sub-interface view,Layer 2 sub-interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 3999.

Specifies the name of a named ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the version number of IGMP packets.
The value is an integer that is 1, 2, or 3.

ExtraInfo: The igmp snooping group-policy command is used to limit the range of multicast groups that user hosts can join.
